Sentencas: In this paper the potential of time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectroscopy combined with focused ion beamtechnology to characterize the composition of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in three-dimension is demonstrated.
Titulo: State-of-the-Art Three-Dimensional Chemical Characterization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Focused Ion Beam Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Tomography

Sentencas: The very high sensitivity of this method allows even very small amounts of elements/compounds to be detected and localized.
Titulo: State-of-the-Art Three-Dimensional Chemical Characterization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Focused Ion Beam Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Tomography

Sentencas: Therefore, interlayer diffusion of elements between porous electrodes and presence of pollutants can be analyzed with a spatial resolution of the order of 100 nm.
Titulo: State-of-the-Art Three-Dimensional Chemical Characterization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Focused Ion Beam Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Tomography

Sentencas: However, proper element recognition and mass interference still remain important issues.
Titulo: State-of-the-Art Three-Dimensional Chemical Characterization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Focused Ion Beam Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Tomography

Sentencas: Here, we present a complete elemental analysis of the SOFC as well as techniques that help to validate the reliability of obtained results.
Titulo: State-of-the-Art Three-Dimensional Chemical Characterization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Focused Ion Beam Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Tomography

Sentencas: A discussion on origins of probable artifacts is provided.
